page.title: 19James Herriot-The Vet.
page.content: Dog walking, reading, music and football are the main interests of one of Britain's best known and loved writers. His Yorkshire tales of a vet's life are told with an insight into the heart of human relationships, which has given his work a world wide appeal. Tourists of all nationalities visit his surgery in Thirsk. His fame in both science and literature is reflected by honorary degrees in Veterinery Science from Liverpool University,and in Literature from Heriot Watt University,Edinburgh; his fellowship of the R.C.V.S.,and by the award of the O.B.E.. Sunderland born,Glasgow raised,James Herriot has been an adopted Yorkshireman for most of his life, and despite his fame he still works as a vet.,together with his son, in the county he as grown to love.
